references.paper_title: Reversible instance normalization for accurate time-series forecasting against distribution shift
references.reason: This paper introduces reversible normalization, a technique crucial to addressing non-stationarity in time series forecasting, which is a core focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Informer: Beyond efficient transformer for long sequence time-series forecasting
references.reason: This paper proposes Informer, a highly influential deep learning model for time series forecasting, serving as one of the baselines for comparative analysis in this work.

references.paper_title: Fedformer: Frequency enhanced decomposed transformer for long-term series forecasting
references.reason: This paper introduces FEDformer, another key deep learning model used for time series forecasting that is compared against the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Non-stationary transformers: Exploring the stationarity in time series forecasting
references.reason: This work directly addresses non-stationarity in time series forecasting, proposing a solution that the current paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Adaptive normalization for non-stationary time series forecasting: A temporal slice perspective
references.reason: This paper introduces SAN, a state-of-the-art normalization method for non-stationary time series forecasting, which this paper improves upon.
